item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, January 25, 2025 at 11:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. First Look: Loops, by Pixelfed – Decentralised TikTok Competitor (2024) (57 points | 20 comments)
2. The FizzBuzz that did not get me the job (140 points | 76 comments)
3. An overview of gradient descent optimization algorithms (19 points | 4 comments)
4. Life lessons from the first half-century of my career (176 points | 38 comments)
5. Gongzilla: The collapsing cost of dumb ideas (10 points | discuss)
6. Show HN: Cs16.css – CSS library based on Counter Strike 1.6 UI (641 points | 112 comments)
7. File Explorer is merged to Helix editor (136 points | 14 comments)
8. TinyZero (85 points | 16 comments)
9. Show HN: Trolling SMS spammers with Ollama (211 points | 69 comments)
10. Wild – A fast linker for Linux (325 points | 157 comments)
11. Show HN: Using YOLO to Detect Office Chairs in 40M Hotel Photos (144 points | 64 comments)
12. Show HN: Lightpanda, an open-source headless browser in Zig (208 points | 107 comments)
13. A phishing attack involving g.co, Google's URL shortener (293 points | 126 comments)
14. Snowdrop OS – a homebrew operating system from scratch, in assembly language (251 points | 51 comments)
15. The hidden complexity of scaling WebSockets (129 points | 36 comments)
16. Subpixel Snake [video] (237 points | 47 comments)
17. Her dad, the 10k records he left behind and a viral lesson in grief (107 points | 50 comments)
18. You could have invented Fenwick trees (104 points | 19 comments)
19. Show HN: Onit – open-source ChatGPT Desktop with local mode, Claude, Gemini (121 points | 38 comments)
20. New book-sorting algorithm almost reaches perfection (210 points | 46 comments)
21. Ask HN: Why buy domains and 301 redirect them to me? (309 points | 101 comments)
22. Chatbox: Cross-platform desktop client for ChatGPT, Claude and other LLMs (64 points | 14 comments)
23. How I Use Home Assistant in 2025 (216 points | 235 comments)
24. Anatomy of a Formal Proof (111 points | 6 comments)
25. A very Chicago gamble (143 points | 74 comments)
26. Caltrain's electric fleet more efficient than expected (279 points | 208 comments)
27. A WebAssembly compiler that fits in a tweet (216 points | 27 comments)
28. Cloud Virtualization: Red Hat, AWS Firecracker, and Ubicloud internals (76 points | 11 comments)
29. Every System is a Log: Avoiding coordination in distributed applications (183 points | 131 comments)
30. Urban legend: I think there is a world market for maybe five computers (113 points | 70 comments)
